result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Treveon M Nellum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Treveon M Nellum in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Treveon M Nellum.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Progress Report 10.21.22.

Defendant Treveon M Nellum in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 15.  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Stark, Branch 17 for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAS Case in court for a  Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. 
Defendant failed to appear. Defense waiting for the dpa to be drafted by the state and request a calendar. 
Court imposed and stayed a warrant to the next court date. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
 Court ordered matter adjourned.   Calendar call scheduled August 5, 2022 at 8:30am


Defendant appeared via zoom. Court vacated imposed and stayed warrant. Defendant provided with the next court.
Per email with defense counsel new date selected for a dpa hearing and defense to notify his client. 
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Treveon M Nellum in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court the case is in DPA posture, but an offer is not yet drafted and the defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Treveon M Nellum in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  OFF THE RECORD.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Domask has received discovery and an offer.  The defendant is going to schedule a TAD evaluation to see if there can be DPA resolution.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAB and ALB.

Defendant Treveon M Nellum in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1:30p

Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
10/3/2021
